file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 25-23-01-04 - SIDEWALL LINING PANELS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL SIDEWALL LINING PANELS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the sidewall lining panels. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ACFT MODEL(S) 25-23-01-000-802-A SIDEWALL LINING PANELS - REMOVAL EMB-135 ACFT MODEL(S) SIDEWALL LINING PANELS - INSTALLA- 25-23-01-400-802-A EMB-135 TION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-2 25-23-01 Page 1 of 15 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-23-01-000-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 2. SIDEWALL LINING PANELS - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the sidewall lining panels. (2) The sidewall lining panels are installed along the passenger cabin, in zones 231, 232, 241, 242, 251, 252, 261, and 262. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-21-01-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-27-16-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-27-19-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-30-07-000-801-A/400 - ITEM GSE 369 CATCH RELEASE TOOL, WINDOW REVEAL TASK 25-26-04-000-802-A - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY To aid the window-reveal assembly removal GSE 369 Catch Release Tool, Window Reveal from the sidewall lining panel E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-024-B (1) Remove the passenger seats (AMM TASK 25-21-01-000-801-A/400) as applicable. (2) Remove the LH side galley (AMM TASK 25-30-07-000-801-A/400) if applicable. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-23-01 Page 2 of 15 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Remove the LH wardrobe (TASK 25-26-04-000-802-A) if applicable. (4) For aircraft with VIP-A and VIP-B configurations, do these steps: (a) Remove the class curtain (AMM TASK 25-27-19-000-801-A/400) if applicable. (b) Remove the class partition (AMM TASK 25-27-16-000-801-A/400) if applicable. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-027-A (1) Remove the sidewall lining panels as follows: NOTE: You must use this procedure for all types of sidewall lining panels. (a) Pull down and remove the trim strips (4). NOTE: • If necessary, you can use a pin in the hole (3) to pull down the trim strip (4). • The RH/LH forward sidewall lining panels (Figure 401, DET. D and DET. F) have only one trim strip. (b) Remove the screws (5) and washers (6). (c) For aircraft with Medevac configuration, unlock the Dzus fasteners (12) with the aid of a wrench to release the passenger-cabin stretcher DC electric outlet (11). Refer to view (S), Figure 401, sheet 9. (d) Remove the sidewall lining panel (2). (2) For aircraft with window reveal attached with turnlock fasteners, remove the window reveal assembly (1) as follows (see DET. L): (a) Turn the lateral locks (3) until you release them from the sidewall lining panel. (b) Push the striker latch (2) to release the window reveal assembly (1). (c) Remove the window reveal assembly (1). (3) For aircraft with window reveal attached with spring-action catch, remove the window reveal assembly (1) as follows (see DET. L): (a) Open the shade (7). (b) Insert a pin in the hole in the bottom of the window to release the center clamp (9). (c) Put the window-reveal catch release tool (ITEM GSE 369) between the sidewall and the window inner reveal to disengage the side clips (8). (d) Pull the window reveal assembly (1) off. (e) Close the shade (7) down. (f) Pull out its bottom and remove the window reveal. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-23-01 Page 3 of 15 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-23-01-400-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 3. SIDEWALL LINING PANELS - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the sidewall lining panels. (2) The sidewall lining panels are installed along the passenger cabin, in zones 231, 232, 241, 242, 251, 252, 261, and 262. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-21-01-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-27-16-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-27-19-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-30-07-400-801-A/400 - ITEM GSE 368 INSTALLER, WINDOW REVEAL TASK 25-26-04-400-802-A - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY To aid the installation of the window reveal GSE 368 Installer, Window Reveal assembly on the sidewall lining panel E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-027-A (1) Install the sidewall lining panels as follows: NOTE: You must use this procedure for all types of sidewall lining panels. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-23-01 Page 13 of 15 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (a) For aircraft with Medevac configuration, put the passenger-cabin stretcher DC electric outlet (11) in position and, with the aid of a wrench, lock the Dzus fasteners (12). Refer to view (S), Figure 401, sheet 9. (b) Put the sidewall lining panel (2) in position. (c) Attach it with the screws (5) and washers (6). (d) Push the trim strips (4) to their position. NOTE: • If necessary, you can use a pin in the hole (3) to push the trim strips (4) up. • The RH/LH forward sidewall lining panels (Figure 401, DET. D and DET. F) have only one trim strip. (2) For aircraft with window reveal assembly attached with turnlock fasteners, install the window reveal as follows (refer to DET. L): (a) Put the window reveal assembly (1) in position. (b) Push the window reveal assembly (1) against the striker latch (2) until it locks. (c) Turn the lateral locks (3) until they lock on the sidewall lining panel. (3) For aircraft with window reveal assembly (1) attached with spring-action catch, install the window reveal as follows (refer to DET. L): (a) Shut the shade (7) down and put the window reveal assembly (1) in its hole. Put the top first. (b) Hold the top flange of the reveal and slide the top clips behind the sidewall. NOTE: When the top is in position, you can move the shade (7) fully up and down. (c) Push the window in its hole until the two side clips (8) and the bottom clip lock closed. (d) As an aid to lock the bottom clip, use the window reveal installer (ITEM GSE 368) to hold the sidewall: hold the striker latch (10) while you push the outboard bottom part of the inner window reveal. (e) Push the window in its hole until the two side clips (8) and the bottom clip lock closed. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 841-025-B (1) Install the removed passenger seats back (AMM TASK 25-21-01-400-801-A/400). (2) If you removed the LH wardrobe, install it back (TASK 25-26-04-400-802-A). (3) If you removed the LH side galley, install it back (AMM TASK 25-30-07-400-801-A/ 400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-23-01 Page 14 of 15 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) For aircraft with VIP-A and VIP-B configurations: (a) If you removed the class curtain, install it back (AMM TASK 25-27-19-400-801-A/ 400). (b) If you removed the class partition, install it back (AMM TASK 25-27-16-400-801- A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-23-01 Page 15 of 15 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
